li.a: Texas Comptroller's Annual Local Debt Report
Federal Report Card for Texas Public Schools

p.br:
Given the rapidly evolving situation with COVID-19, Sidney ISD will extend the suspension of normal district operations through Monday, May 4th as ordered by Governor Abbott in an effort to slow the spread of the novel coronavirus, or COVID-19. Sidney ISD will continue to deliver instruction during this time.
This is a quickly changing situation, and we will continue on a daily basis to monitor information. Thank you for your support and cooperation as we ensure that all stay safe and healthy.

div.div: Candidate application is located in the superintendent office 4100 Hwy 1689 Sidney, TX 76474. Any other inquiries can be made by calling 254-842-5500 ext 112 NOTICE OF ELECTION.pdfRead more...

div.a: Sidney ISD uses the SchoolMessenger Notification System

div.div: Sidney ISD uses the SchoolMessenger Notification System to provide timely communication to parents and staff members on matters such as attendance, lunch balances, transportation, general interest act...Read more...

p.a: TCEQ (Texas Commission on Environmental Quality) Drinking Water Notice

div.div: Our missions at SISD is to provide a high quality education for all students within a safe and secure learning environment in order to prepare students for a lifetime of learning and developing necessary skills through vigorous instruction that challenges each student to become successful and responsible global citizens.
